alert.note: Alert for Chittenden (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 2:27AM EST until December 19 at 6:34PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...Observed flooding changed to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Vermont... Winooski River At Essex Junction affecting Chittenden County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winooski River at Essex Junction. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...Until the river stage falls below 15 feet, flooding will continue to be widespread from Jonesville to the rivers mouth at Lake Champlain. Water will cover Bridge Street in Richmond, North Williston Road in Williston and Essex, Poor Farm Road in South Burlington and Williston. The Burlington Intervale will continue be inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:30 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:30 AM EST Tuesday was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 4.9 feet Thursday evening. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.3 feet on 04/12/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 230 PM EST.
